description: <p>Registered Nurse – Wheatfields Hospice<br /><br />Competitive salary, enhancements, continuation of your NHS pension & NHS annual leave honoured.<br /><br />Are you looking for a new challenge and the opportunity to make a real difference within your community?<br /><br />You are invited to join us at Sue Ryder Wheatfields Hospice and become part of our well-established team.<br /><br />We are seeking compassionate and dedicated Nurses who are looking to make a difference.<br /><br />We welcome applications from newly qualified Nurses.<br /><br />About the Role:<br /><br />We have full time vacancies up to 37.5 hours per week and this can be discussed at interview.<br /><br />We can offer you long days if requested to complement a work life balance.<br /><br />The successful applicants will play an active role within our team, providing excellent personalized care. It's all about giving them the best possible quality of life. The support we offer is tailored to meet individuals' medical, social, spiritual and emotional needs.<br /><br />About you:<br /><br />Ideally you will be an NMC registered nurse, with post-registration experience in palliative end of life care<br /><br />You will need to be able to demonstrate the ability to work well within a team, use initiative and have excellent communication skills.<br /><br />You will also:<br /><br />- Assess, plan, implement and evaluate individualised care using evidence-based guidelines<br />- Maintain high standards of care delivery by working collaboratively within regulatory body standards and the Sue Ryder Quality Governance Policy<br />- Provide support, leadership appraisal and supervision to team members as appropriate<br />- Act as an ambassador of Sue Ryder to service users and their relatives, colleagues and members of the public<br /><br />About Us:<br /><br />Wheatfields is a Sue Ryder Hospice based in Leeds .We provides expert palliative and end of life care, in a beautiful setting, for thousands of local people each year. We are part of a large charity but have a close relationship within the local community and offer a large range of specialist services to support patients, their families and friends.<br /><br />Competitive Benefits:<br />• Up to £24,755 - £30,054 pro-rata, per annum (DOE)<br />• 25 days holiday - rising to 30 with length of service plus bank holidays<br />• Option to buy and sell up to five days holiday<br />• Competitive enhanced pay for nights, weekends and public holidays<br />• NHS holiday honoured up to a maximum of 30 days (Terms and Conditions apply)<br />• Continuation of NHS pension<br />• Company pension scheme<br />• Enhanced maternity and paternity benefits<br />• Enhanced sick pay<br />• Cash referral bonus scheme<br />• Carer’s leave policy<br />• 24 hour employee assistance line for free advice on work, family and personal life<br />• PeoplePerks - discounts with hundreds of retailers and services<br />• Staff discounts of 15% at the Sue Ryder online shop<br />• Cycle to work scheme<br />• Staff loans and company car loans<br />• Free parking, subsidised meals & drinks<br />• Wellbeing centre and free will writing service<br />• Development opportunities for all through our structured development framework<br /><br />For more information and informal discussion please contact Sue Waddington on 0113 278 7249 or email sue.waddington@suerydercare.org<br /><br />Sue Ryder supports people through the most difficult times of their lives. Whether that’s a terminal illness, the loss of a loved one or a neurological condition – we’re there when it matters. Our doctors, nurses and carers give people the compassion and expert care they need to help them live the best life they possibly can.</p>
title: Registered Nurse
